title: Draco Malfoy Brings Luck for Chinese New Year
summary: Draco Malfoy, a character from Harry Potter, has become a fun mascot for Lunar New Year in China. His Chinese name, Ma-er-fu, sounds like words for horse and fortune, which is lucky because this year is the Year of the Horse. People in China love Harry Potter, so they are using pictures of Draco Malfoy to decorate their homes. They stick his picture on doors or hang it upside down for good luck. On social media, fans share these pictures and say they bring fortune. Even the actor who plays Draco, Tom Felton, noticed this trend and shared it online, making fans happy. This shows how a movie character can become part of a holiday tradition.

background_read: Lunar New Year is a special time in China when families celebrate with decorations, food, and traditions to bring good luck for the coming year. People often use red colors and symbols like horses or fortune words. Harry Potter is a popular book and movie series about wizards, and Draco Malfoy is a character from it. In China, fans enjoy mixing their love for Harry Potter with holiday customs, creating new and fun ways to celebrate.
